column2: Rate of acute hepatitis B per 100,000 population
Crude incidence rate of new diagnoses of confirmed acute hepatitis B per 100,000 population
No calculations were performed in the data acquisition of this indicator as appropriate data was readily available in the final format specified by this indicator.

National metadata: Source 1 link to data source text

column2: Every effort is made to ensure accuracy and completeness of the data. At a national level, data are de-duplicated to prevent double counting of the same individual. The sum of the local authority data may not equal the regional and overall England data because for some individuals only the region or country of residence is available. In 2016, 98% of cases could be mapped to a lower/upper tier local authority. The surveillance definition for acute hepatitis B is 'HBsAg positive, anti-HBc IgM positive and abnormal liver function tests with a pattern consistent with acute viral hepatitis'.
